payload.name: bayesian-probabilistic
payload.core: Represent degrees of belief as probabilities and update them with evidence via Bayes' rule: P(H|E) = P(E|H) * P(H) / P(E). Posterior = (Likelihood * Prior) / Evidence. Normative standard for belief updating under uncertainty.

out.d: explicit beliefs before new evidence with source
how posterior changes with prior/likelihood changes
point estimates or thresholds for action

proc: specify prior: source (base rates, expert, previous posteriors), range, rationale
construct likelihood model: P(E|H) for each hypothesis, compare across H
apply Bayes' rule: P(H|E) proportional to P(E|H) * P(H), normalize
test sensitivity: vary prior and likelihood, flag if posterior highly sensitive
extract decision-relevant summary: P(success), expected value, hypothesis ratios
update iteratively: today's posterior becomes tomorrow's prior
check: likelihood model specified for each hypothesis
sensitivity analysis on prior and likelihood

diff.frequentist: reports P(hypothesis|data) directly vs P(data|hypothesis) over repetitions
diff.likelihood-based: adds priors for full posteriors vs compares P(E|H) without priors
diff.reference-class: uses base rates as prior input vs provides the prior
diff.decision-theoretic: produces posteriors vs consumes them for action choice
diff.inductive: formalizes belief updating vs informal pattern generalization

signals: high confidence despite rare base rate
prior described as uninformative without justification
mitigations: anchor priors in base rates via reference-class
separate likelihood statements from posterior claims
incremental updates, skepticism of large jumps

ex.sit: Rare disease (1% prevalence), test sensitivity 95%, specificity 90%. Patient tests positive.
steps: interpret: only 8.8% chance despite positive test
sensitivity: if prevalence 10%, posterior would be 51%
ex.insight: low base rate means most positive tests are false positives; P(E|H) is not P(H|E)
